What does paper that could last for over 1,000 years look like? How is it made? Follow me to Xizang (Tibet) and learn the skills of Tibetan paper-making. Btw, stellera chamaejasme's roots, which are poisonous (also reason for the paper's endurance), are used as raw materials.
#PatrickInXizang

legacy.description:
M.A.
American in China, Published Author, Radio Show Host, Podcaster & Media Commentator. Opinions are my own.
legacy.name: Jason Smith - 上官杰文

legacy.full_text:
Exactly. Why should people learn English to accommodate western propagandists?

When I was in Xizang, EVERYONE knew what I meant when I said Xizang, and almost no one knew the word English word 'Tibet.'

It's like calling Guangzhou 'Canton,' or Beijing 'Peking.'

#Xizang #Tibet
I was in Xizang (Tibet) a few days ago.  Absolutely wonderful place with natural and cultural wonders. https://t.co/ewZ6F9gsk9

legacy.description: News editor, researcher on China. Fact over falsehood.  Follow my YouTube channel here↓

result.text: Now this is from one of my followers who wishes to remain anonymous: "The same China hawks have zero recollection of how US native tribes were treated and left in social state of disrepute. They also think cultures are either fully assimilated or fully independent, which makes zero sense. Cultures embed over time like in all global regions."

legacy.description: News editor, researcher on China. Fact over falsehood.  Follow my YouTube channel here↓
legacy.name: Patrick Zheng小強在中國

result.text:
Interesting. The China hawks @committeeonccp @RepGallagher now see people won't buy their Xinjiang genocide story, so they come up with the Tibetan cultural genocide one.

But wait, according to census data, the population of Tibetan children aged below 14 is around 895k, how come there're 1 mln separated from parents? 

And they won't tell you boarding schools are built with better resources to provide better education given the low population density (1/60 of national average) in Xizang (Tibet); they won't tell you parents and students are free to decide whether to board or not; they won't tell you schools provide Tibetan language education from Grade 1 to Grade 12;  they won't tell you food, accommodation and tuition fees at such schools are covered by the govt
#PatrickInXizang

result.text:
Don't miss it, the world's largest urban park and largest urban wetlands -- Lalu Wetlands National Nature Reserve in Lhasa, Xizang (Tibet)😘

It's dubbed "the Lungs of Lhasa", and believe it or not, even as an altitude sickness sufferer, I could drop my oxygen cylinder here!😳 #PatrickInXizang

legacy.full_text:
Driving along world's highest major river -- the Yarlung Zangbo River in Xizang (#Tibet)😊

It also boasts world's deepest canyon with a maximum depth of 6,009 metres😱

But equally astonishing are the roads/bridges constructed alongside/across the river👍

#PatrickInXizang https://t.co/C6QNjT33bp

legacy.description: News editor, researcher on China. Fact over falsehood.  Follow my YouTube channel here↓
legacy.name: Patrick Zheng小強在中國

result.text:
Can you tell these pictures are actually shown on a fan?😱 Through hologram technology, it shows the playing of an eagle flute, a traditional Tibetan instrument.

Crafted from the wing bone of an eagle, it boasts a rich history spanning over a millennium. Inhabitants of the grasslands turn to this instrument as a remedy for solitude while grazing. To craft an eagle flute, herders spend a lot of time looking for the bones of a dead eagle.👍

You can find the fan at 吉本岗艺术中心 in Lhasa, Xizang (#Tibet)🇨🇳

#PatrickInXizang

result.text:
Erasing Tibetan identity?😳 @committeeonccp @RepGallagher Not what I've seen. Bilingual/trilingual signs everywhere. Name me a US city that uses American Indian languages in its road signs.🤔

Brand-new tunnels, highways & bridges everywhere in a plateau with an altitude of over 3000 metres.🇨🇳 Again, name me another country that does so in large scale.

But then altitude sickness is real ...😭

To be continued.

@Kanthan2030 @AndyBxxx @BarrettYouTube

😱Mass gathering of Tibetans, a lot in untidy clothes and eating by roadside?

Not the sort of story anti-China hawks would crave for. These Tibetans are in fact lining up to volunteer for the annual renovation of the Potala Palace's exterior.❤️

Nice to see them honoring their belief wholeheartedly!👍

result.text:
Dining at a Tibetan restaurant. The boss said his favorite dish is "yak-dung bread" which he and his wife invented.

In Tibetan culture and customs, yak dung is not only an important fuel, but also has its unique significance in some special ceremonies and festivals. #PatrickInXizang
